method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a browse node ID, BrowseNodeLookup returns the specified browse node’s name, children, and ancestors. The names and browse node IDs of the children and ancestor browse nodes are also returned.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartCreate request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartCreate. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: BrowseNodeId
param.doc: A positive integer assigned by Amazon that uniquely identifies a product category.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds items to an existing remote shopping cart.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartCreate request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartCreate. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: CartId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart.

param.name: Item.n.ASIN
param.doc: Specifies ASIN of item to be added to the cart where N is a positive integer between 1 and 10, inclusive. Up to ten items can be added at a time. Using an item's OfferListingId is preferred instead of the item's ASIN. Required if an OfferListingId is not specified.

param.name: Item.n.Quantity
param.doc: Specifies number of items to be added to the cart where N is a positive integer. Valid Values: Positive integer between 1 and 999, inclusive.

param.name: HMAC
param.doc: The Hash Message Authentication Code is an encrypted alphanumeric token that is used to authenticate requests. Value is calculated using request parameters, their values, a cryptographic function, and the Secret Key, which acts as the "key" for the function.

param.name: MergeCart
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated. When a customer purchases items in a remote shopping cart, the items are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart.

param.name: OfferListingId
param.doc: An offer listing ID is a token that uniquely identifies an item that is sold by any merchant, including Amazon. This parameter is preferred to using an ASIN to add an item to a cart. Required if ASIN is not offered.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes all of the items in a remote shopping cart, including SavedForLater items. To remove only some of the items in a cart or to reduce the quantity of one or more items, use CartModify.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartCreate request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartCreate. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase. This value is required only if the cart was created using the AssociateTag.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: CartId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart.

param.name: HMAC
param.doc: The Hash Message Authentication Code is an encrypted alphanumeric token that is used to authenticate requests. Value is calculated using request parameters, their values, a cryptographic function, and the Secret Key, which acts as the "key" for the function.

param.name: MergeCart
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated. When a customer purchases items in a remote shopping cart, the items are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartCreate request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartCreate. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase. If it is included, it must be included on all future cart operations associated with this cart.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: Item.n.ASIN
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an item. Using OfferListingId is preferred instead of ASIN when adding items to a cart. Required if OfferListingId is not used.

param.name: Item.n.Quantity
param.doc: The suffix used with Item to specify the number of items to be added to the cart, for example, Item.1.ASIN=0976925524, Item.1.Quantity=2. Valid Values: Positive integer

param.name: ListItemId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an item on a wishlist. This value is returned by the ListItem response group. The ListItemId attaches to the request the name and address of the list owner, which the ASIN alone does not. An ASIN or OfferListingId is still required in addition to ListItemId.

param.name: MergeCart
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated. When a customer purchases items in a remote shopping cart, the items are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart.

param.name: OfferListingId
param.doc: An offer listing ID is an alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an item. Use the OfferListingId instead of an item's ASIN to add the item to the cart. Required if ASIN is not used.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Retrieves the IDs, quantities, and prices of all of the items, including SavedForLater items in a remote shopping cart.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartGet request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartGet. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase. This value is required only if the cart was created using an AssociateTag.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: CartId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart.

param.name: CartItemId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an item in a cart. Once an item, specified by an ASIN or OfferListingId, has been added to a cart, you must use the CartItemId to refer to it. The other identifiers will not work.

param.name: HMAC
param.doc: The Hash Message Authentication Code is an encrypted alphanumeric token that is used to authenticate requests. Value is calculated using request parameters, their values, a cryptographic function, and the Secret Key, which acts as the "key" for the function.

param.name: MergeCart
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated. When a customer purchases items in a remote shopping cart, the items are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Changes the quantity of items that are already in a remote shopping cart and move items from the active area of a cart to the SaveForLater area or the reverse.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the CartModify request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by CartModify. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: CartId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate that identifies a cart.

param.name: Item.n.CartItemId
param.doc: Specifies an item to be modified in the cart where N is a positive integer between 1 and 10, inclusive. Up to ten items can be modified at a time.CartItemId is neither an ASIN nor an OfferListingId. It is, instead, an alphanumeric token returned by CartCreate and CartAdd. This parameter is used in conjunction with Item.N.Quantity to modify the number of items in a cart. See Item, that follows, for more information.

param.name: Item.n.Quantity
param.doc: Specifies the revised number of items that the customer would like in the cart where N is a positive integer. This parameter is used in conjunction with Item.N.CartItemId to modify the number of items in a cart. The Quantity value is matched to the Item.N.CartItemId value by the index number, N. For example, Item.1.CartItemId is associated with Item.1.Quantity. Constraint: N is a positive integer between 0 and 999, inclusive.

param.name: Item.n.Action
param.doc: Use this parameter to change cart items to move items to the Saved-For-Later area, or change Saved-For-Later (SaveForLater) items to the active cart area (MoveToCart).

param.name: HMAC
param.doc: The Hash Message Authentication Code is an encrypted alphanumeric token that is used to authenticate requests. Value is calculated using request parameters, their values, a cryptographic function, and the Secret Key, which acts as the "key" for the function. Value returned by CartCreate.

param.name: MergeCart
param.doc: This parameter is deprecated. When a customer purchases items in a remote shopping cart, the items are added to the customer’s Amazon retail shopping cart.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an Item identifier, the returns some or all of the item attributes, depending on the response group specified in the request.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the ItemLookup request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by ItemLookup. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: Condition
param.doc: Specifies an item's condition. If Condition is set to “All,” a separate set of responses is returned for each valid value of Condition. The default value is "New" (not "All"). So, if your request does not return results, consider setting the value to "All." When the value is "New," the ItemSearch Availability parameter cannot be set to "Available." Amazon only sells items that are "New."

param.name: IdType
param.doc: Type of item identifier used to look up an item. All IdTypes except ASINx require a SearchIndex to be specified. SKU requires a MerchantId to be specified also.

param.name: IncludeReviewsSummary
param.doc: When set to true, returns the reviews summary within the Reviews iframe.

param.name: ItemId
param.doc: One or more (up to ten) positive integers that uniquely identify an item. The meaning of the number is specified by IdType. That is, if IdType is ASIN, the ItemId value is an ASIN. If ItemIdis an ASIN, a search index cannot be specified in the request. Must be a valid item ID. For more than one ID, use a comma-separated list of up to ten IDs.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: Specifies the merchant who is offering the item. MerchantId is an alphanumeric identifier assigned by Amazon to merchants. Note that the default value is "Amazon." If your request does not generate results, consider setting the value to "All."

param.name: OfferPage
param.doc: Page of offers returned by ItemLookup. There are 10 offers per page. To examine offers 11 trough 20, for example, set OfferPage to 2. Valid Values: Integer between 1 and 100, inclusive

param.name: RelatedItemPage
param.doc: This optional parameter is only valid when the RelatedItems response group is used. Each ItemLookup request can return, at most, ten related items. The RelatedItemPage value specifies the set of ten related items to return. A value of 2, for example, returns the second set of ten related items.

param.name: RelationshipType
param.doc: This parameter is required when the RelatedItems response group is used. The type of related item returned is specified by the RelationshipType parameter. Sample values include Episode, Season, and Tracks. For a complete list of types, see Relationship Types page in the API documentation. Required when RelatedItems response group is used.

param.name: ReviewPage
param.doc: Page of reviews returned by ItemLookup. There are 5 reviews per page. To examine reviews 6 through 10, for example, set ReviewPage to 2. Valid Values: Integer between 1 and 20, inclusive

param.name: ReviewSort
param.doc: Specifies the order in which Reviews are sorted in the return.

param.name: SearchIndex
param.doc: The product category to search. Valid Values: A search index, for example, Apparel, Beauty, Blended, Books, and so forth. Constraint:If ItemIdis an ASIN, a search index cannot be specified in the request. Required for non-ASIN ItemIds.

param.name: TagPage
param.doc: Specifies the page of results to return. There are ten results on a page. Constraint: The maximum page number is 400.

param.name: TagsPerPage
param.doc: The number of tags to return that are associated with a specified item.

param.name: TagSort
param.doc: Specifies the sorting order for the results.

option.doc: Sort by the date the item was first used.
Sort by the date the item was first used, reversed.
Sort by the date the item was last used.
Sort by the date the item was last used, reversed.
Items least used to most used.
Items most used to least used.

param.name: TruncateReviewsAt
param.doc: By default, reviews are truncated to 1000 characters within the Reviews iframe. To specify a different length, enter the value. To return complete reviews, specify 0. Constraints: Must be a positive integer or 0 (returns entire review)

param.name: VariationPage
param.doc: Page number of variations returned by ItemLookup. By default, ItemLookup returns all variations. Use VariationPage to return a subsection of the response. There are 10 variations per page. To examine offers 11 trough 20, for example, set VariationPage to 2. Valid Values: Integer between 1 and 150, inclusive

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns items that satisfy the search criteria, including one or more search indices.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the ItemSearch request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by ItemSearch. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: Actor
param.doc: Name of an actor associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Artist
param.doc: Name of an artist associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: AudienceRating
param.doc: Movie ratings based on MPAA ratings or age, depending upon the locale. You may specify one or more values in a comma-separated list.

param.name: Author
param.doc: Name of an author associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Brand
param.doc: Name of a brand associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: BrowseNode
param.doc: A positive integer that identifies a product category, for example, Literature & Fiction: (17), Medicine: (13996), Mystery & Thrillers: (18), Nonfiction: (53), Outdoors & Nature: (290060).

param.name: City
param.doc: Name of a city associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name. This parameter only works in the US locale.

param.name: Composer
param.doc: Name of a composer associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Conductor
param.doc: Name of a conductor associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Director
param.doc: Name of a director associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Keywords
param.doc: A word or phrase associated with an item. The word or phrase can be in various product fields, including product title, author, artist, description, manufacturer, and so forth. When, for example, the search index equals "MusicTracks," the Keywords parameter enables you to search by song title.

param.name: Manufacturer
param.doc: Name of a manufacturer associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: MusicLabel
param.doc: Name of a music label associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Neighborhood
param.doc: Name of a neighborhood You can enter all or part of the name. The neighborhoods are located in one of the valid values for City.

param.name: Orchestra
param.doc: Name of an orchestra associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: Power
param.doc: Performs a book search using a complex query string. Only works when the search index is set equal to "Books."

param.name: Publisher
param.doc: Name of a publisher associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the name.

param.name: TextStream
param.doc: A search based on two or more words. ItemSearch picks out of the block of text up to ten keywords and returns up to ten items that match those keywords. For example, if five keywords are found, two items for each keyword are returned. Only one page of results is returned so ItemPage does not work with TextStream.

param.name: Title
param.doc: The title associated with the item. You can enter all or part of the title. Title searches are a subset of Keyword searches. If a Title search yields insufficient results, consider using a Keywords search.

param.name: Availability
param.doc: Enables ItemSearch to return only those items that are available. This parameter must be used in combination with a merchant ID and Condition. For more information, see Availability Parameter, which follows this table.When Availability is set to "Available," the Condition parameter cannot be set to "New."

param.name: Condition
param.doc: Use the Condition parameter to filter the offers returned in the product list by condition type. By default, Condition equals "New". If you do not get results, consider changing the value to "All. When the Availability parameter is set to "Available," the Condition parameter cannot be set to "New." ItemSearch returns up to ten search results at a time. When condition equals "All," ItemSearch returns up to three offers per condition (if they exist), for example, three new, three used, three refurbished, and three collectible items. Or, for example, if there are no collectible or refurbished offers, ItemSearch returns three new and three used offers.

param.name: IncludeReviewsSummary
param.doc: When set to true, returns the reviews summary within the Reviews iframe.

param.name: ItemPage
param.doc: Retrieves a specific page of items from all of the items in a response. Up to ten items are returned on a page unless Condition equals "All." In that case, ItemSearch returns up to three results per Condition, for example, three new, three used, three refurbished, and three collectible items. Or, for example, if there are no collectible or refurbished items being offered, ItemSearch returns three new and three used items. If you do not include ItemPage in your request, the first page is returned. The total number of pages of items found is returned in the TotalPages response tag. Valid Values: 1 to 400 (1 to 5 when the search index = "All")

param.name: MaximumPrice
param.doc: Specifies the maximum price of the items in the response. Prices are in terms of the lowest currency denomination, for example, pennies. For example, 3241 represents $32.41.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: Specifies the merchant who is selling the item. MerchantId is an alphanumeric identifier assigned by Amazon to merchants. Make sure to specify a merchant ID and not a seller ID, which is not supported. Note that the default value is "Amazon." If your request does not generate results, consider setting the value to "All."

param.name: MinimumPrice
param.doc: Specifies the minimum price of the items to return. Prices are in terms of the lowest currency denomination, for example, pennies, for example, 3241 represents $32.41.

param.name: PostalCode
param.doc: Postal code of the merchant. In the US, the postal code is the postal code. This parameter enables you to search for items sold in a specified region of a country.

param.name: RelatedItemPage
param.doc: This optional parameter is only valid when the RelatedItems response group is used. Each ItemLookup request can return, at most, ten related items. The RelatedItemPage value specifies the set of ten related items to return. A value of 2, for example, returns the second set of ten related items.

param.name: RelationshipType
param.doc: This parameter is required when the RelatedItems response group is used. The type of related item returned is specified by the RelationshipType parameter. Sample values include Episode, Season, and Tracks.

param.name: ReviewSort
param.doc: Sorts reviews based on the value of the parameter.

param.name: SearchIndex
param.doc: The product category to search. Many ItemSearch parameters are valid with only specific values of SearchIndex. Valid Values: A search index, for example, Apparel, Beauty, Blended, Books, and so forth.

param.name: Sort
param.doc: Means by which the items in the response are ordered. Valid Values: Valid values vary significantly by search index.

param.name: TagPage
param.doc: Specifies the page of results to return. There are ten results on a page. The maximum page number is 400.

param.name: TagsPerPage
param.doc: The number of tags to return that are associated with a specified item.

param.name: TagSort
param.doc: Specifies the sorting order for the results.

option.doc: Sort by the date the item was first used.
Sort by the date the item was first used, reversed.
Sort by the date the item was last used.
Sort by the date the item was last used, reversed.
Items least used to most used.
Items most used to least used.

param.name: TruncateReviewsAt
param.doc: By default, reviews are truncated to 1000 characters within the Reviews iframe. To specify a different length, enter the value. To return complete reviews, specify 0. Constraints: Must be a positive integer or 0 (returns entire review)

param.name: VariationPage
param.doc: Retrieves a specific page of variations returned by ItemSearch. By default, ItemSearch returns all variations. Use VariationPage to return a subsection of the response. There are 10 variations per page. To examine offers 11 trough 20, for example, set VariationPage to 2. The total number of pages is returned in the TotalPages element.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns information about a seller's listings, including product descriptions, availability, condition, and quantity available.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the SellerListingLookup request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by SellerListingLookup. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: Id
param.doc: Number that uniquely identifies an item. The valid value depends on the value for IdType.

param.name: IdType
param.doc: Use the IdType parameter to specify the value type of the Id parameter value. If you are looking up an Amazon Marketplace item, use Exchange, ASIN, or SKU as the value for IdType. Discontinued, out of stock, or unavailable products will not be returned if IdType is Listing, SKU, or ASIN. Those products will be returned, however, if IdType is Exchange.

param.name: SellerId
param.doc: Alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies a seller. This parameter limits the results to a single seller ID. Required except when IdType = Exchange.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Searches for items offered by specific sellers.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the SellerListingSearch request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by SellerListingSearch. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: ListingPage
param.doc: Page of the response to return. Up to ten lists are returned per page. For customers that have more than ten lists, more than one page of results are returned. By default, the first page is returned. To return another page, specify the page number. Constraint: Maximum value is 500.

param.name: OfferStatus
param.doc: Specifies whether the product is available (Open), or not (Closed.) Closed products are those that are discontinued, out of stock, or unavailable.

param.name: SellerId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies a seller. These tokens are created by Amazon and distributed to sellers.

param.name: Sort
param.doc: Use the Sort parameter to specify how your seller listing search results will be ordered. The -bfp (featured listings - default), applies only to the US, UK, and DE locales.

param.name: Title
param.doc: Searches for products based on the product’s name . Keywords and Title are mutually exclusive; you can have only one of the two in a request. The value can be multiple words, as long as the spaces are URL-encoded as %20. Word order does not matter and case is not significant.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns detailed information about sellers and, in the US locale, merchants.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the SellerLookup request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by SellerLookup. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: FeedbackPage
param.doc: Specifies the page of reviews to return. Up to five reviews are returned per page. The first page is returned by default. To access additional pages, use this parameter to specify the desired page. The maximum number of pages that can be returned is 10 (50 feedback items). Valid Values: Integer between 1 and 10, inclusive

param.name: SellerId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that identifies the seller. Valid Values: A valid Seller ID, which is provided by Amazon. In the US locale, you can use a merchant ID.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns up to ten products per page that are similar to one or more items specified in the request.

param.name: AssociateTag
param.doc: An alphanumeric token that uniquely identifies an Associate. This token is the means by which Amazon identifies the Associate to credit for a sale. If a request is made without identifying an Associate, Associate fees are not paid by Amazon. If the AssociateTag is included in the SimilarityLookup request, the value for AssociateTag is automatically included in the PurchaseURL, which is returned by SimilarityLookup. Valid Values: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies an Associate. Use this value in all requests to receive credit for the customer's purchase.

param.name: ContentType
param.doc: Specifies the format of the content in the response. Generally, ContentType should only be changed for REST requests when the Style parameter is set to an XSLT stylesheet. For example, to transform your Product Advertising API response into HTML, set ContentType to text/html. See Style.

param.name: MarketplaceDomain
param.doc: Specifies the Marketplace Domain within which to make the request. Do not use this parameter unless making a request against one of the domains specified in the list of valid values.

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: An alphanumeric token distributed by Amazon that uniquely identifies a merchant. See API docs for valid values.

param.name: Style
param.doc: Controls the format of the data returned in Product Advertising API responses. Style only pertains to REST requests. Set this parameter to "XML," the default, to generate a pure XML response. Set this parameter to the URL of an XSLT stylesheet to have Product Advertising API transform the XML response. See ContentType.

param.name: Validate
param.doc: Prevents an operation from executing. Set the Validate parameter to True to test your request without actually executing it. When present, Validate must equal True; the default value is False. If a request is not actually executed (Validate=True), only a subset of the errors for a request may be returned because some errors (for example, no_exact_matches) are only generated during the execution of a request.

param.name: Version
param.doc: The version of the Product Advertising API software and WSDL to use. By default, the 2005-10-05 version is used. Alternately, specify a software version, such as 2010-11-01. For a list of valid version numbers, refer to the Product Advertising API Release Notes. Note that the latest version of Product Advertising API is not used by default.

param.name: XMLEscaping
param.doc: Specifies whether responses are XML-encoded in a single pass or a double pass. By default, XMLEscaping is Single, and Product Advertising API responses are encoded only once in XML. For example, if the response data includes an ampersand character (&), the character is returned in its regular XML encoding (&). If XMLEscaping is Double, the same ampersand character is XML-encoded twice (&). The Double value for XMLEscaping is useful in some clients, such as PHP, that do not decode text within XML elements.

param.name: Condition
param.doc: Specifies an item's condition. If Condition is set to “All,” a separate set of responses is returned for each valid value of Condition.

param.name: ItemId
param.doc: Specifies the item you want to look up. An ItemId is an alphanumeric identifier assigned to an item. You can specify up to ten ItemIds separated by commas. Valid Values: ASIN

param.name: MerchantId
param.doc: Specifies the merchant who is offering the item. MerchantId is an alphanumeric identifier assigned by Amazon to merchants. Make sure to use a Merchant ID and not a Seller ID. Seller IDs are not supported.

param.name: SimilarityType
param.doc: "Intersection" returns the intersection of items that are similar to all of the ASINs specified. "Random" returns the union of items that are similar to all of the ASINs specified. Only ten items are returned. So, if there are more than ten similar items found, a random selection from the group is returned. For this reason, running the same request multiple times can yield different results.

param.name: ResponseGroup
param.doc: Specifies the types of values to return. You can specify multiple response groups in one request by separating them with commas.
